result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Makayla Wilson

records.addlTxt: 22R 011227  Bond posted at Sheriff's Dept on 10/28/2022.

Not to possess any dangerous weapons or Oleoresin spray. No contact with Piggly Wiggly in Port Washington. No contact with TLW. No contact with Co-Defendant WC. Defendant to avoid WC or the victim's residence and/or any location temporarily occupied by WC or the victim. The defendant avoid contacting WC or the victim or causing any person other than a party's attorney or law enforcement officer to contact WC or the victim. Contact includes: contact at WC or victim's home, work, school, public places, in person, by phone, in writing, by electronic communication or device, or in any other manner. To remain in home except for school, medical appointments, religious observances, or work. Provide Court with attendance records from high school on every other week basis.

8:33 AM Defendant Makayla Wilson appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Makayla Wilson.  Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin. Bond reduction motion heard. Arguments. Court makes findings and reduces bail.
Filed by attorney Dvoran. Document for review to B2.
Motion hearing on October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Not to possess any dangerous weapons or Oleoresin spray. No contact with Piggly Wiggly in Port Washington. No contact with TLW. No contact with Co-Defendant WC. Defendant to avoid WC or the victim's residence and/or any location temporarily occupied by WC or the victim. The defendant avoid contacting WC or the victim or causing any person other than a party's attorney or law enforcement officer to contact WC or the victim. Contact includes: contact at WC or victim's home, work, school, public places, in person, by phone, in writing, by electronic communication or device, or in any other manner. To remain in home except for school, medical appointments, or religious observances.

1:26 PM Defendant Makayla Wilson appeared by video from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Makayla Wilson.  Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant qualifies for PD. Court advises of charges/penalties and finds probable cause. State recommends $5000 cash bail w/conditions. Counsel requests low cash bail. Court finds good cause to extend time limits.
Status hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.
